d.title: Email verification code input does not work with iOS autofill
d.body:
### Checklist

- [X] I could not find a solution in the existing issues or docs.
- [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/teamhanko/hanko/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md).

### Describe the bug

It only fills in a single box/digit, if it works at all.

### Reproducing the bug

Log in with passcode on an iOS17/18 iPhone where the email account used for logging in is configured in the Mail app.

Perhaps related to this issue: https://forums.developer.apple.com/forums/thread/738690

### Hanko Version

0.10

d.title: frontend(examples): angular example no longer working
d.body:
### Checklist

- [X] I could not find a solution in the existing issues or docs.
- [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/teamhanko/hanko/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md).

### Describe the bug

The Angular example no longer works properly. There are two failure scenarios:

1. When starting the Angular example from the `frontend/examples/angular` directory via `npm run start` using a Hanko Cloud instance and specifying its corresponding API URL  in the `frontend/examples/angular/src/environment/environment.ts` file, the application does start up but the <hanko-auth> element cannot be rendered on visiting the default `http://localhost:8888`. Instead, there is a console error in the browser: 

```
ERROR TypeError: Cannot read properties of null (reading 'bindingStartIndex')
    at ɵɵelementStart (core.mjs:13575:46)
    at Module.ɵɵelement (core.mjs:13656:5)
    at AppComponent_Template (app.component.html:1:1)
    at executeTemplate (core.mjs:10457:9)
    at renderView (core.mjs:10279:13)
    at renderComponent (core.mjs:11450:5)
    at renderChildComponents (core.mjs:10138:9)
    at renderView (core.mjs:10304:13)
    at ComponentFactory.create (core.mjs:12194:13)
    at ApplicationRef.bootstrap (core.mjs:25271:42)
```

2. When using the `docker compose -f deploy/docker-compose/base.yaml -f deploy/docker-compose/todo-angular.yaml -p "hanko-todo-angular" up --build` command as described in the `frontend/README.md` file, the compose cluster starts up but any attempt to access `http://localhost:8888` results in a `404` response.





### Reproducing the bug

# Scenario 1:

1. Check out current state of the repository
1. Create account in Hanko Cloud
2. Set App URL to "http://localhost:8888"
3. In the `frontend/` directory run `npm install`
4. Open `frontend/examples/angular/src/environment/environment.ts` file and enter your Hanko Cloud Instance API URL
5. In the `frontend/examples/angular` directory, run `npm run start` (if it does not work, try another `npm install` in the `frontend` directory)
6. Go to `http://localhost:8888` in your browser
7. Open  your browsers developer tools
8. Observe above mentioned error

# Scenario 2:

1. Check out current state of the repository
3. In the repository root issue the following command on your shell (as described in `frontend/examples/README.md`): `docker compose -f deploy/docker-compose/base.yaml -f deploy/docker-compose/todo-angular.yaml -p "hanko-todo-angular" up --build`
4. Go to `http://localhost:8888` in your browser
5. Observe a `404` with an error message `Cannot GET /` in your browser 

### Logs

_No response_

### Configuration

_No response_

### Hanko Version

e7dc097baf4ca9930f3b082335f8d27c48384fed

### OS Hanko Backend

None

### OS Version Hanko Backend

_No response_

### OS

None

### OS Version

_No response_

### Browser Version

_No response_

### Environment

None

### Additional Context

_No response_

d.title: Following NextJS Guide doesn't work
d.body:
### Checklist

- [X] I could not find a solution in the existing issues or docs.
- [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/teamhanko/hanko/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md).

### Describe the bug

Hi,

I have followed the nextjs guide [here](https://docs.hanko.io/guides/next) and I get the following two errors:

1. in vscode, typescript says: `Module '"@teamhanko/hanko-elements"' has no exported member 'Hanko'.` on the line `import { register, Hanko } from "@teamhanko/hanko-elements";`
2. when running the app locally (using `npm run dev`) the login screen shows a generic error UI and the terminal outputs: `ReferenceError: CustomEvent is not defined`

### Reproducing the bug

1. `npx create-next-app@13.4.19 repro`
2. follow the steps at https://docs.hanko.io/guides/next
3. `npx tsc` to repro the first bug
4. `npm run dev`
5. navigate to `localhost:3000/login` to repro the second bug

### Logs

```Shell
npm run dev                                            

> app@0.1.0 dev
> next dev

- info Loaded env from [redacted].env
- ready started server on [::]:3000, url: http://localhost:3000
- event compiled client and server successfully in 227 ms (20 modules)
- wait compiling...
- event compiled client and server successfully in 103 ms (20 modules)
- info Loaded env from [redacted].env
- info Loaded env from [redacted].env
- wait compiling /login/page (client and server)...

warn - No utility classes were detected in your source files. If this is unexpected, double-check the `content` option in your Tailwind CSS configuration.
warn - https://tailwindcss.com/docs/content-configuration
- event compiled client and server successfully in 746 ms (388 modules)
- wait compiling...
- event compiled successfully in 49 ms (222 modules)
- error node_modules/@teamhanko/hanko-elements/dist/elements.js (2:54703) @ eval
- error ReferenceError: CustomEvent is not defined
    at __webpack_require__ ([redacted]/.next/server/webpack-runtime.js:33:42)
    at eval (./components/hanko/auth.tsx:11:83)
    at (ssr)/./components/hanko/auth.tsx ([redacted]/.next/server/app/login/page.js:315:1)
    at __webpack_require__ ([redacted]/.next/server/webpack-runtime.js:33:42)
null
- wait compiling /favicon.ico/route (client and server)...
- event compiled client and server successfully in 141 ms (443 modules)
```


### Configuration

```yml
# package.json

{
  "name": "app",
  "version": "0.1.0",
  "private": true,
  "scripts": {
    "dev": "next dev",
    "build": "next build",
    "start": "next start",
    "lint": "next lint"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "@teamhanko/hanko-elements": "0.8.3",
    "@types/node": "20.5.7",
    "@types/react": "18.2.21",
    "@types/react-dom": "18.2.7",
    "autoprefixer": "10.4.15",
    "eslint": "8.48.0",
    "eslint-config-next": "13.4.19",
    "jose": "^4.14.4",
    "next": "13.4.19",
    "postcss": "8.4.29",
    "react": "18.2.0",
    "react-dom": "18.2.0",
    "tailwindcss": "3.3.3",
    "typescript": "5.2.2"
  }
}
```

d.title: Background of input remains transparent if using autofill in dark-mode apps
d.body:
### Checklist

- [X] I could not find a solution in the existing issues or docs.
- [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/teamhanko/hanko/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md).

### Describe the bug

https://github.com/teamhanko/hanko/assets/62984427/c4d80d2d-9b00-4f73-b7eb-692155b65669


**How to fix it?**
`--background-color` should be same as background.

The bug is that we are giving `--background-color: transparent` inside hanko-auth, hanko-profile{} section, instead it should be the same as the actual background color, on which Hanko is added, which is `#262b35` in our case.

Reason: To override the default color of the autofill in the browser, it falls back to the background color that we have provided, which is transparent in our case, due to which the autofill background remains transparent.


### Reproducing the bug

Go to hanko cloud signup/in page
Chooose autofill for email

### Logs

_No response_

### Configuration

_No response_

### Hanko Version

Not sure

### OS Hanko Backend

None

### OS Version Hanko Backend

_No response_

### OS

None

### OS Version

_No response_

### Browser Version

_No response_

### Environment

None

### Additional Context

_No response_

d.title: CustomEvent is not defined
d.body:
### Checklist

- [X] I could not find a solution in the existing issues or docs.
- [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/teamhanko/hanko/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md).

### Describe the bug

- error node_modules\@teamhanko\hanko-frontend-sdk\dist\sdk.modern.js (1:4914) @ eval
- error ReferenceError: CustomEvent is not defined

Using the _"@teamhanko/hanko-frontend-sdk": "^0.8.0",_ in  _"next": "13.4.7",_



### Reproducing the bug

I'd reckon how to reproduce this error is to

1. Init a nextjs app with versioning 13.4.7
2. Install the _"@teamhanko/hanko-frontend-sdk": "^0.8.0",_
3. Init the hanko client provided by the frontend sdk
4. Try to use the passcode feature
5. You will see this error on import and usage.
6. My current impression is that on import it's expecting some core browser features in turn resulting in the error (nextjs 13 has moved to server first which further contributes to this)


### Logs

```Shell
`- error node_modules\@teamhanko\hanko-frontend-sdk\dist\sdk.modern.js (1:4914) @ eval
- error ReferenceError: CustomEvent is not defined
    at __webpack_require__ (direcotorypathtothisfolder\.next\server\webpack-runtime.js:33:43)
    at eval (./src/lib/file.tsx:53:87)
    at (sc_client)/./src/lib/file.tsx (direcotorypathtothisfolder\.next\server\app\(dashboard)\path\page.js:16256:1)

    at __webpack_require__ (direcotorypathtothisfolder\.next\server\webpack-runtime.js:33:43)
    at JSON.parse (<anonymous>)`
```

d.title: OAuth sign-in to Google/OSM returns 400 Bad Request on custom Hanko domain while same flow succeeds on cloud.hanko.io
d.body:
### Checklist

- [x] I could not find a solution in the existing issues or docs.
- [x] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/teamhanko/hanko/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md).

### Describe the bug

When initiating third‑party OAuth sign-in via Hanko on a custom domain (https://dev.login.hotosm.org), the thirdparty_oauth action consistently returns 400 Bad Request. The same flow with the same provider and payload succeeds (200) when pointed at https://login.cloud.hanko.io. The failing response includes error.code = "form_data_invalid_error" and does not set the hanko_thirdparty_state cookie.

### Reproducing the bug

1. Open the web client at `https://ui.hotosm.org` in a fresh browser session (no cookies).
2. Start login and select Google (or OpenStreetMap) as the provider.
3. The client issues:
   - POST `https://dev.login.hotosm.org/login?action=thirdparty_oauth%40<flow-id>`
   - Headers include `Origin: https://ui.hotosm.org` and `Content-Type: application/json`.
   - Body (example):
     ```json
     {
       "provider": "google",
       "redirect_to": "https://ui.hotosm.org/auth/callback"
     }
     ```
4. Observe a 400 response with JSON error and no `Set-Cookie: hanko_thirdparty_state=...`.
5. Repeat the same request against `https://login.cloud.hanko.io/login?action=thirdparty_oauth%40<flow-id>` and observe 200 OK with `Set-Cookie: hanko_thirdparty_state=...; HttpOnly; Secure; SameSite=None`.


### Logs

```Shell
Successful environment (cloud.hanko.io) response highlights:
- Status: 200
- Set-Cookie:
  `hanko_thirdparty_state=...; Domain=cloud.hanko.io; Max-Age=300; HttpOnly; Secure; SameSite=None`

Failing environment (dev.login.hotosm.org) response highlights:
- Status: 400 Bad Request
- Body:
  
  {
    "name": "login_init",
    "status": 400,
    "payload": {
      "request_options": {
        "publicKey": {
          "challenge": "…",
          "rpId": "dev.login.hotosm.org",
          "timeout": 600000,
          "userVerification": "preferred"
        }
      }
    },
    "csrf_token": "…",
    "actions": {
      "thirdparty_oauth": {
        "href": "/login?action=thirdparty_oauth%40<flow-id>",
        "inputs": {
          "provider": { "allowed_values": [
            { "value": "google" },
            { "value": "custom_openstreetmap" }
          ]},
          "redirect_to": {}
        }
      }
    },
    "error": {
      "code": "form_data_invalid_error",
      "message": "Form data invalid."
    },
    "links": null
  }
  
Request headers (failing):
- `Origin: https://ui.hotosm.org`
- `Content-Type: application/json`
- User-Agent: Chrome/138

Response headers (failing):
- Status: 400
- No `Set-Cookie: hanko_thirdparty_state=...`
```

### Configuration

```yml
server:
  public:
    base_url: https://dev.login.hotosm.org
cors:
  allowed_origins:
    - https://ui.hotosm.org
thirdparty:
  providers:
    google:
      client_id: <redacted>
      client_secret: <redacted>
      redirect_url: https://ui.hotosm.org/auth/callback
    custom_openstreetmap:
      client_id: <redacted>
      client_secret: <redacted>
      redirect_url: https://ui.hotosm.org/auth/callback
cookies:
  secure: true
  samesite: none
```

### Hanko Version

"@teamhanko/hanko-elements": "^2.1.0",

### OS Hanko Backend

Linux

### OS Version Hanko Backend

_No response_

### OS

Linux

### OS Version

_No response_

### Browser Version

Google Chrome 138.0.x

### Environment

Docker Compose

### Additional Context

- Works on `login.cloud.hanko.io` (200 + `hanko_thirdparty_state` cookie).
- Fails on `dev.login.hotosm.org` (400 + `form_data_invalid_error`, no state cookie).
- Screenshots attached show full request/response headers for both environments.
- Suspicions: Origin/cookie domain/flow‑id scoping or `redirect_to` validation differences between environments. Guidance on additional diagnostics (e.g., enabling debug logs for the thirdparty flow or specific config flags to validate `redirect_to`) would be appreciated.

- Implemented a complete, ready-to-post issue using your template.
- Highlighted the 400 vs 200 behavior, the missing `hanko_thirdparty_state` cookie, and provided concrete repro steps and payloads.
- Added placeholders where details are unknown so you can fill them quickly.

d.title: `session.cookie.domain` not being used correctly
d.body: ### Checklist - [X] I could not find a solution in the existing issues or docs. - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/teamhanko/hanko/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md). ### Describe the bug I am using Hanko for my project [Codefarem](https://github.com/IgnisDa/codefarem). It is live on the subdomain https://codefarem.ignisda.tech. Since it uses a subdomain, I have set `session.cookie.domain` to `.codefarem.ignisda.tech`. However, when the `/finalize` endpoint is called, it sends the domain as `codefarem.ignisda.tech`. As a result, the cookie is not set and I immediately get this error: `Your session has expired. Please log in again`. **TLDR: The leading `.` is not respected.** ### Reproducing the bug You can try to sign up on https://codefarem.ignisda.tech/auth to see the above problem. ### Logs ```Shell 2022-12-04T04:20:20.990713489Z app[web.1]: 2022/12/04 04:20:20 Using config file: ./config/config.yaml 2022-12-04T04:20:20.996329093Z app[web.1]: 2022/12/04 04:20:20 migrate up 2022-12-04T04:20:21.403762499Z app[web.1]: [POP] 2022/12/04 04:20:21 info - Migrations already up to date, nothing to apply 2022-12-04T04:20:21.404357581Z app[web.1]: [POP] 2022/12/04 04:20:21 info - 0.4063 seconds 2022-12-04T04:20:21.519800089Z app[web.1]: 2022/12/04 04:20:21 Using config file: ./config/config.yaml 2022-12-04T04:20:21.712076042Z app[web.1]: ⇨ http server started on [::]:5000 2022-12-04T04:20:53.978966815Z app[web.1]: {"time":"2022-12-04T04:20:53.977793706Z","time_unix":"1670127653","id":"WPkq3flobQc5g4me7d6HO28FTbUcfTOs","remote_ip":"103.79.169.10","host":"codefarem--authenticator.ignisda.tech","method":"OPTIONS","uri":"/.well-known/config","user_agent":"Mozilla/5.0 (X11; d.title: Strange state behavior during registration flow
d.body:
### Checklist

- [x] I could not find a solution in the existing issues or docs.
- [x] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/teamhanko/hanko/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md).

### Describe the bug

I am learning using hanko to build a mobile component. 
I am using a local self hosted docker image for this and I am experiencing a strange behavior during registration in case of registering an email address which is already registered.

Every http calls is done using Postman. The sequence of steps is this

1. I send an empty request to `/registration`. The server returns 200 with a single available action (`register_client_capabilities`)
2. I then send a `register_client_capabilities` request and the server returns 200 with a single action, `register_login_identifier`, requiring the filed email in input 
```
inputs: {
  email: {  name: "email",  type: "email", max_length: 255, required: true }
}
```
3. I then send a `register_login_identifier` request containing an already registered email address. 

**Request**
```
POST /registration?action=register_login_identifier@... 
{ 
    "csrf_token":"...",
    "input_data": {
        "email":"existing@email.com"
    }
}

```
**Response**
```
Status [200] 
{
    "name":"passcode_confirmation",
    "status":200,
    "payload": {},
    "csrf_token": "UmMYBEPKzrtfXyQqSYdZUx3fBYDsjCks",
    "actions": {
        "back": {
            "href":"/registration?action=back@db4cdf87-1acf-4690-8f21-84bd6286e717",
                "inputs": {},
           "action": "back", 
           "description": "Navigate one step back."
        },
       "resend_passcode": { 
           "href": "/registration?action=resend_passcode@db4cdf87-1acf-4690-8f21-84bd6286e717",
           "inputs":{},
           "action": "resend_passcode",
           "description":"Send the passcode email again."
        },
        "verify_passcode": {
            "href": "/registration?action=verify_passcode@db4cdf87-1acf-4690-8f21-84bd6286e717",
            "inputs": {
                "code": { "name": "code", "type": "string", "required": true }
            },
           "action": "verify_passcode",
           "description": "Enter a passcode."
        }
    },
    "links":null
}
```

**Problem #1**: Without returning any evidence how can I handle the error?
 
Almost immediately I also receive two webhooks containing exactly the sampe payload but having different values  in the event attribute (respectively `email.send` and `email_registration_attempted`. This is the payload: 
```
{
    "subject": "Provided email address already taken",
    "body_plain": "You or someone else tried to register an email for Hanko, but the provided email address is already registered. Please try to log in instead.",
    "body": "...", 
    "to_email_address": "existing@email.com", 
    "delivered_by_hanko": false, 
    "accept_language": "en", 
    "language": "en", 
    "type": "email_registration_attempted", 
    "data": { 
        "service_name":"hanko", 
        "otp_code": "449823", 
        "ttl": 300, 
        "valid_until": 1760086885
    }
}
```

**Problem #2**: There are a few issues with this:
- The payload is received twice under different names. I can not assure if this is a personal mistake at the moment. 
- The payload contains an `otp _code` set. 

**Problem #3**: I have then decided to invoke the `back` action followed by, again, the same `register_login_identifier` (again with the same existing email). In this case I still receive 200 with the same answer as before but in this case no webhooks are sent.

Hope I am not misusing the api expecting behavior that it is'nt designed for. My initial objective was to understand how to intercept errors during the registration process 

### Reproducing the bug

The steps described above are those needed to reproduce it.

### Logs

```Shell
The log does not report any useful information
```

### Configuration

```yml

```

### Hanko Version

Latest

### OS Hanko Backend

None

### OS Version Hanko Backend

_No response_

### OS

Linux

### OS Version

_No response_

### Browser Version

_No response_

### Environment

None

### Additional Context

_No response_

d.title: hanko on mariadb doesn't work
d.body:
### Checklist - [X] I could not find a solution in the existing issues or docs. - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/teamhanko/hanko/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md). ### Describe the bug Hi! Recently I tried to deploy a fresh and self-hosted (localhost) installation of hanko on mariadb and failed. Logs of hanko-migrade repeatedly displays ``` 2025/01/06 21:57:44 migrate up 2025/01/06 21:57:44 Using config file: /etc/config/config.yaml [POP] 2025/01/06 21:57:44 info - 0.0363 seconds 2025/01/06 21:57:44 error executing migrations/20240717020707_change_flows.up.fizz, sql: ALTER TABLE `flows` ADD COLUMN `data` VARCHAR (65536) NOT NULL; ALTER TABLE `flows` DROP COLUMN `stash_data`; ALTER TABLE `flows` DROP COLUMN `current_state`; ALTER TABLE `flows` DROP COLUMN `previous_state`;: Error 1074 (42000): Column length too big for column 'data' (max = 16383); use BLOB or TEXT instead ``` As we can see, it's not possible to apply some ALTER TABLE to flows table from backend/persistence/migrations/20240717020707_change_flows.up.fizz ```SQL add_column("flows", "data", "string", {"size": 65536}) ``` OK. A quick googleing brought up some clarifications: ``` The reason for this is that the maximum number of bytes that MySQL can store in a VARCHAR column is 65,535, and that is 21845 characters for utf8mb3 character set and 16383 characters for the utf8mb4 character set. ``` This is confirmed by checking the table itself: ```SQL select * from information_schema.tables where table_name='flows' ``` ``` TABLE_CATALOG TABLE_SCHEMA TABLE_NAME TABLE_TYPE ENGINE VERSION ROW_FORMAT TABLE_ROWS AVG_ROW_LENGTH DATA_LENGTH MAX_DATA_LENGTH INDEX_LENGTH DATA_FREE AUTO_INCREMENT CREATE_TIME UPDATE_TIME CHECK_TIME TABLE_COLLATION CHECKSUM CREATE_OPTIONS TABLE_COMMENT MAX_INDEX_LENGTH TEMPORARY def passkey flows BASE TABLE InnoDB 10 Dynamic 0 0 16384 0 0 0 NULL 2025-01-06 21:18:59 NULL NULL utf8mb4_uca1400_ai_ci NULL 0 N ``` By default, a new table was created with utf8mb4_uca1400_ai_ci. Which is reasonable, because it implements modern The Unicode Standard, Version 14.0. Just as an experiment, I tried a dirty hack (the idea was that latin2 charset uses 1 byte instead of 4 for utf8mb4 charset) ```SQL ALTER TABLE flows CHARACTER SET latin2 COLLATE latin2_general_ci; ``` But it with no success ``` Column length too big for column 'data' (max = 65532); use BLOB or TEXT instead ``` As I learned, Mariadb have internal limitations: row limit is 65535 (sic! it's exactly 4 byte). But even more, on top of that it's require two bytes to store some length. And in the bottom line mariadb allows allocate only 65532 per row. But in this case 20240717020707_change_flows.up.fizz fix tries to set field length to 65536. Which is a bit of a strange choice, as you probably know in memory representation it's 4 byte + 1 bit. And it looks like there is no chance to set this length in Mariadb. So, I'm on the fence now with full of questions. Is it do supposed to store real 4-bytes-UTF-8 in the DATA field of the FLOWS table? Does the DATA field really have to be that big (65536)? ### Reproducing the bug Run podman/docker compose using the following backend.yaml
backend.yaml ```dockerfile version: "3.9" services: hanko-migrate: container_name: hanko-migrate build: ../../backend volumes: - type: bind source: ./custom.config.yaml target: /etc/config/config.yaml command: --config /etc/config/config.yaml migrate up restart: on-failure depends_on: mariadb: condition: service_healthy networks: - intranet hanko: container_name: hanko depends_on: hanko-migrate: condition: service_completed_successfully build: context: ../../backend dockerfile: Dockerfile # dockerfile: Dockerfile.debug security_opt: - "apparmor=unconfined" cap_add: - SYS_PTRACE ports: - "8000:8000" # public - "8001:8001" # admin # - "40000:40000" # debug restart: unless-stopped command: serve --config /etc/config/config.yaml all volumes: - type: bind source: ./custom.config.yaml target: /etc/config/config.yaml networks: - intranet environment: - PASSWORD_ENABLED mariadb: container_name: mariadb image: mariadb:11 ports: - "3306:3306" environment: - MARIADB_USER=hanko - MARIADB_PASSWORD=hanko - MARIADB_DATABASE=hanko - MARIADB_RANDOM_ROOT_PASSWORD=true healthcheck: interval: 30s retries: 3 test: [ "CMD", "healthcheck.sh", "--su-mysql", "--connect", "--innodb_initialized", ] timeout: 30s start_period: 30s networks: - intranet networks: intranet: ```

then check logs with ```sh podman logs --follow hanko-migrate ``` ### Logs _No response_ ### Configuration _No response_ ### Hanko Version fc80743a93754b8fb302055e7a1d8b5c62aa4d63 ### OS Hanko Backend None ### OS Version Hanko Backend _No response_ ### OS None ### OS Version _No response_ ### Browser Version _No response_ ### Environment Docker Compose ### Additional Context _No response_

d.title: form_data_invalid_error not working
d.body:
### Checklist

- [X] I could not find a solution in the existing issues or docs.
- [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/teamhanko/hanko/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md).

### Describe the bug

The form_data_invalid_error error message is not displayed despite the response containing:
error: { code: "form_data_invalid_error", message: "Form data invalid." }

### Reproducing the bug

I have defined two error messages, among others: flowErrors.value_invalid_error and flowErrors.form_data_invalid_error. When I enter an invalid email, such as a1@b2.c3, the response is:

{
  "name": "login_init",
  ...
  "error": {
    "code": "form_data_invalid_error",
    "message": "Form data invalid."
  }
}

However, the error message from flowErrors.value_invalid_error is displayed instead. In my opinion, this is incorrect.

### Logs

_No response_

### Configuration

_No response_

@teamhanko/hanko-elements@1.3.0

None

d.title: Module '"@teamhanko/hanko-elements"' has no exported member 'Hanko'
d.body:
### Checklist

- [X] I could not find a solution in the existing issues or docs.
- [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/teamhanko/hanko/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md).

### Describe the bug

It's giving error while importing Hanko from "@teamhanko/hanko-elements"

![Screenshot 2023-10-10 113313](https://github.com/teamhanko/hanko/assets/120788538/6a862b34-b0f5-4ee1-8098-6a8ef84db1d4)


### Reproducing the bug

Steps to reproduce the error:

1. Create an app with next:latest
2. Install hanko and configure it in the app from [docs](https://docs.hanko.io/quickstarts/fullstack/next#install-teamhanko-hanko-elements)
3. While configuring you'll notice errors in HankoAuth.tsx and Logout.tsx
4. There's was an error in setting up the environment variable also
![Screenshot 2023-10-10 114042](https://github.com/teamhanko/hanko/assets/120788538/0c6ccb84-40b0-4730-888f-491d193e91ce)
5. This can be gone by adding "!" at the end: `const hankoApi = process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_HANKO_API_URL!;` as mentioned on [stackoverflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/54496398/typescript-type-string-undefined-is-not-assignable-to-type-string)


### Logs

_No response_

### Configuration

_No response_

### Hanko Version

0.8.3

### OS Hanko Backend

None

### OS Version Hanko Backend

_No response_

### OS

Windows

_No response_

### Browser Version

_No response_

### Environment

None

### Additional Context

_No response_
